description: Moderate - Broader Skill Set Required - Need proficiency in both frontend and backend technologies, making it more challenging than specializing in one area, but highly versatile and in-demand especially for startups
dailyWork: Building features end-to-end from database to user interface
Designing and implementing both frontend components and backend APIs
Creating database schemas and writing SQL queries
Implementing authentication and authorization flows (login, signup, JWT, sessions)
Integrating frontend with backend APIs (fetch, axios, handling responses)
Building responsive UI components that work across devices
Writing server-side logic and business rules
Implementing real-time features using WebSockets or polling

careerProgression.timelineToSenior: 5-7 years with demonstrated ability to build scalable, production-ready applications independently across the entire stack
alternativePaths: Specialize in Frontend (React expert, design systems engineer)
Specialize in Backend (API architect, microservices specialist)

learningCurve.description: **Moderate** - More breadth than depth required. Need to learn both frontend and backend, but can be less deep in each compared to specialists. Modern full-stack frameworks (Next.js, Blitz.js) simplify development. Realistic timeline: 12-18 months to become proficient in a full stack (MERN/MEAN).

factors: Responsible for entire application - bugs can be anywhere in the stack
Context switching between frontend and backend work (mentally demanding)
Broader responsibility - need to handle UI bugs, API issues, database problems
Higher expectations - expected to be productive across the entire stack
On-call for full stack - can't pass issues to specialists
mitigatingFactors: High satisfaction - see complete features come to life (very rewarding)
Versatility - can switch contexts, not monotonous
High demand - easy job mobility if stressed
Better compensation - 10-20% premium justifies the effort

thriveIf: You enjoy variety and don't want to specialize too early in your career
You like understanding the complete application flow from database to UI
You're comfortable switching contexts between frontend and backend work
You enjoy being self-sufficient and building complete features independently
You're a generalist who likes learning broadly rather than deep specialization
You want maximum flexibility in the job market (most job opportunities)
You're curious about all aspects of software development
avoidIf: You prefer deep specialization in one specific area
You find context switching stressful and disorienting
You want to focus only on frontend OR backend, not both
You dislike managing deployment and infrastructure responsibilities
You prefer working in large teams with clear role boundaries

collegeStrategy.title: Foundation
goals: MERN Stack (MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js) - Most Popular in India
MEAN Stack (MongoDB, Express, Angular, Node.js) - Enterprise
Java Stack (Spring Boot + React + MySQL) - Enterprise jobs

collegeStrategy.title: Job Hunt
goals: Polish portfolio with 3-5 exceptional full-stack projects
Each showing different skills and complexity

technicalPrep.skill: Choose and Master ONE Full-Stack (Don't Spread Too Thin)
technicalPrep.goal: - **MERN Stack (RECOMMENDED - 60% of full-stack jobs in India):**
- **3-5 complete, production-ready applications** showing end-to-end ownership
- **Frontend architecture:** Component structure, state management, routing

applicationStrategy.approach: - Early-stage startups need full-stack engineers (can do everything)
- Lead with portfolio in all applications

differentiators: Complete, deployed full-stack applications (not just frontend or backend)
